Don't edit this page, just click on the version number! --> | programming language = [[C++]] | operating system = [[Unix-like]], [[Microsoft Windows]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://code.google.com/p/znc-msvc/ |title=Native windows port Code.google.com Retrieved on 2011-11-28 |publisher=Code.google.com |date= |accessdate=2012-04-16}}</ref> | status = Active | genre = [[bouncer (networking)|IRC bouncer]] | license = [[Apache License]] | website = [http://wiki.znc.in/ZNC www.znc.in] }} {{Portal|Free software}} '''ZNC''' is an [[Internet Relay Chat|IRC]] [[bouncer (networking)|network bouncer]] or BNC. It can detach the client from the actual IRC server, and also from selected channels. Multiple clients from different locations can connect to a single ZNC account simultaneously and therefore appear under the same nickname on IRC. It supports [[Secure Sockets Layer|SSL]] secured connections and [[IPv6]]. ZNC is written in [[C++]] and licensed under the [[Apache License]]. The main program, which already features multiple users, per channel playback buffers and transparent [[Direct Client-to-Client|DCC]] bouncing, can be extended using modules. Modules can be written in [[Python (programming language)|Python]], [[Perl]], [[Tcl]], or [[C++]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.znc.in/wiki/ZNC |title=Official ZNC site retrieved 11 July 2009 |publisher=En.znc.in |date=2012-04-11 |accessdate=2012-04-16}}</ref> Available modules comprise logging functionality, [[Blowfish (cipher)|Blowfish]] encryption, user and channel management, away functionality, a partyline and more.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.znc.in/wiki/Modules |title=Modules list on ZNC site retrieved 11 July 2009 |publisher=En.znc.in |date=2012-01-29 |accessdate=2012-04-16}}</ref> A very popular module is ''webadmin'': it provides a way to manage users and channels conveniently using only a web browser. ZNC also supports ident spoofing via [[oidentd]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.znc.in/wiki/Using_ident_spoofs |title=Using ident spoofs â€“ ZNC En.znc.in (2011-07-13) Retrieved on 2011-11-28 |publisher=En.znc.in |date=2012-03-25 |accessdate=2012-04-16}}</ref> ZNC has been in development since August 2004,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://znc.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/znc?view=rev&revision=2 |title=SourceForge revision history retrieved 11 July 2009 |publisher=Znc.svn.sourceforge.net |date= |accessdate=2012-04-16}}</ref> and new releases are made regularly. It has received favorable reviews,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ohloh.net/p/znc |title=ZNC on Ohloh retrieved 11 July 2009 |publisher=Ohloh.net |date= |accessdate=2012-04-16}}</ref> especially in comparison to [[psyBNC]], and has an active community on IRC. In mid-2009, ZNC popularity gained momentum among [[iPhone]] users when a push module for mobile [[Colloquy (IRC client)|Colloquy]] nick highlight notifications<ref>{{cite web|url=http://colloquy.info/project/wiki/PushNotifications |title=Official Colloquy website retrieved 31 August 2009 |publisher=Colloquy.info |date= |accessdate=2012-04-16}}</ref> and another module for iPhone notifications via [[Growl (software)|Growl]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.znc.in/wiki/Prowl |title=Prowl znc.in. retrieved 31 August 2009 |publisher=En.znc.in |date=2011-12-17 |accessdate=2012-04-16}}</ref> were published. ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == * {{Official website|http://www.znc.in/}} * [http://github.com/znc/znc ZNC] at [[GitHub]] * {{Freshmeat|znc|ZNC}} * [irc://irc.efnet.org/znc #ZNC] on [[EFnet]] {{IRC bouncers}} [[Category:Internet Relay Chat bouncers, gateways and proxies]] [[Category:Internet privacy software]] [[Category:Free software programmed in C++]] [[Category:2004 software]]
